questions.q: Which radiation therapy technique is most appropriate for treating early-stage prostate cancer?
questions.explanation: External beam radiation therapy is the standard radiation treatment for early-stage prostate cancer

questions.q: What is the most common acute side effect of radiation therapy?
questions.explanation: Fatigue is the most common acute side effect experienced by patients receiving radiation therapy

questions.q: Lowered hemoglobin during normal pregnancy is a physiological finding. It's mainly due to:
questions.A: Low iron stores in all women
questions.D: Increased cardiac output resulting in greater red cell destruction
questions.explanation: Increased plasma volume leads to hemodilution and lowered hemoglobin

questions.q: The maternal blood volume in normal pregnancy:
During pregnancy, maternal estrogen levels increase markedly. Most of this estrogen is produced by the:
questions.explanation: The placenta is a major producer of estrogen during pregnancy

questions.q: During normal pregnancy, the renal glomerular filtration rate (GFR) can increase as much as:
Fetal blood is returned to the umbilical arteries and the placenta through:
questions.explanation: Hypogastric arteries return fetal blood to the placenta

questions.q: In normal physiological changes in pregnancy, all of the following are increased EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Peripheral resistance decreases in normal pregnancy

questions.q: Regarding renal changes in pregnancy, all of the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.B: Glomerular filtration rate is increased by 50%
questions.explanation: Renal blood flow typically increases by 50%

questions.q: Consequences of fluid retention, all of the following are CORRECT, EXCEPT:
During pregnancy, all of the following are CORRECT EXCEPT:
questions.A: There will be hyperplasia and hypertrophy of the uterine muscle
questions.B: Estradiol will increase the columnar epithelial of the endocervix
questions.C: Estrogen will increase the glandular duct
questions.D: Progestin and HPL will decrease the number of glands
questions.E: Prolactin will be antagonized by the effect of estrogen
questions.explanation: Progestin and HPL increase the number of glands

questions.q: Regarding renal tract during pregnancy, the following are true EXCEPT:
questions.B: The renal pelvis calyces are dilated
questions.C: The right side is affected more than the left side
questions.D: The primigravida shows more changes than multigravida
questions.explanation: Bladder tone typically decreases during pregnancy

questions.q: As pregnancy advances, which of the following hematological changes occurs?
questions.A: Plasma volume increases proportionally more than red cell volume
questions.B: Red cell volume increases proportionally more than plasma volume
questions.C: Plasma volume increases and red cell volume remains constant
questions.D: Red cell volume decreases and plasma volume remains constant
questions.E: Neither plasma volume nor red blood cell volume changes

questions.q: Which of the following would normally be expected to increase during pregnancy:
The supine position is important during late pregnancy because it may cause all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.A: Complete occlusion of the inferior vena cava.
questions.B: A significant decrease in maternal ventilatory capacity.
questions.D: A significant reduction in renal blood flow & glomerular filtration.
questions.E: Augmentation of the cardiovascular effects due to high conduction

questions.q: Which of the following is probably responsible for physiologic hyperventilation during pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Progesterone is responsible for physiologic hyperventilation during pregnancy.

questions.q: Normally the pregnant woman hyperventilates. This is compensated by:
The resting pulse in pregnancy is:
After birth, all of the following vessels constrict EXCEPT:
Select the most correct statement about fetal & neonatal IgM:
questions.A: It is almost entirely maternal in origin.
questions.B: It is approximately 75% maternal & 25% fetal in origin.
questions.C: It is 50% maternal, 50% fetal in origin.
questions.D: It is 25% maternal, 75% fetal in origin.
questions.E: It is almost entirely fetal in origin.

questions.q: Which one is true about the placenta:
questions.D: Placental lobes are the functional units.

questions.q: Spinnbarkheit is a term which means:
Regarding placental function:
questions.A: hCG is a glycoprotein composed of alpha & Î² subunits. It's secreted by cytotrophoblast.
questions.B: Human placental lactogen enhances insulin action & improves glucose tolerance.
questions.C: Placental corticotropin-releasing hormone increases ACTH & cortisol & causes vasoconstriction of the feto-placental blood vessels.
questions.D: Estrogen is secreted by the feto-placental unit responsible for the growth of the myometrium & angiogenesis.
questions.E: Progesterone causes vasodilatation of blood vessels & contraction of uterine smooth muscle.

questions.q: Regarding placental anatomy:
questions.A: The decidua capsularis forms part of the placenta.
questions.B: The fetal side of the placenta is divided into 30-40 cotyledons.
questions.C: The intervillous space contains fetal blood.
questions.D: Anatomically the placenta is fully formed by 30 weeks.
questions.E: Fetal blood vessels develop in the mesenchymal core of the chorionic villi.

questions.q: Which of the following does NOT accurately describe the placenta in humans:
questions.C: Weighs about 1/6 of what the term infant does.
questions.E: Umbilical cord originates from the center of the placenta in most of the cases.

questions.q: Maternal serum prolactin levels in pregnancy are highest:
questions.A: At the end of gestation just before delivery of the infant.
questions.B: Just after the delivery of the infant.

questions.q: All of the following cause oligohydramnios EXCEPT:
Placental insufficiency is caused by all the following, EXCEPT:
All the following hormones are products of placental synthesis, EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Prolactin is primarily secreted by the pituitary gland

questions.q: We can detect the fetal heartbeat by sonography (transvaginal) at:
A pregnant lady with polyhydramnios, the cause could be:
Polyhydramnios is associated with the following condition:
All the following are possible causes of polyhydramnios, EXCEPT:
questions.D: Fetus with duodenal atresia or neural tube defect

questions.q: Which of the following causes of polyhydramnios is more common:
Using your knowledge of normal maternal physiology, which of the following would employ if a 38 weeksâ pregnant patient become faint while lying supine on your examination table:
questions.B: Turning the patient on her side.

questions.q: Skin changes during pregnancy should include:
questions.explanation: Chloasma, striae, palmar erythema, and vascular angiomas are all skin manifestations in pregnancy.

questions.q: The number of chromosomes in the human somatic cell is:
